Module hanyaeger.api
Package com.github.hanyaeger.api.engine.scenes

Class StaticScene

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.hanyaeger.api.engine.scenes.StaticScene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Activatable, Clearable, DependencyInjector, Destroyable, KeyListener, TileMapListProvider, Initializable, DimensionsProvider, EntityCollectionSupplier, SupplierProvider, YaegerScene
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DynamicScene
    public abstract class StaticScene
extends Object
implements YaegerScene, KeyListener, SupplierProvider, TileMapListProvider, EntityCollectionSupplier, DependencyInjector
    A StaticScene is the abstract superclass of all scenes that do not require a Game Loop. If a Game Loop is required, extend a DynamicScene.

      • addEntity

        protected void addEntity​(YaegerEntity entity)
        Add an YaegerEntity to this YaegerScene. An YaegerEntity can only be added once.

        This method can only be used to add an instance of YaegerEntity during initialisation.If one should be added during the game, a EntitySpawner should be used.

        Parameters:
        entity - the YaegerEntity to be added

      • setStage

        public void setStage​(javafx.stage.Stage stage)
        Description copied from interface: YaegerScene
        Set the Stage on this YaegerScene. A YaegerScene will only be added to the Stage when the YaegerScene is the one that is being shown. Only when a YaegerScene is added, its width and height are available. Thus, to make it possible to request the width and height during the YaegerScene.setupEntities() methods, we need the Stage at an earlier stage. That is why we actively set the Stage on each YaegerScene that is created.
        Specified by:
        setStage in interface YaegerScene
        Parameters:
        stage - The current Stage.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

        • jpg, jpeg
        • png
